contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|Lost|lost}} '''Lost''' may refer to: {{tocright}} ==In cinema or television== *[[Lost (TV series)|''Lost'' (TV series)]], an ABC drama about people who become stranded on a mysterious island *[[Lost (2001 TV series)|''Lost'' (2001 TV series)]], a short-lived reality television program *[[Lost (2004 film)|''Lost'' (2004 film)]], an American thriller starring Dean Cain *[[Lost (1956 film)|''Lost'' (1956 film)]], a British thriller starring David Farrar ==In literature== *[[Lost (novel)|''Lost'' (novel)]], a 2001 horror/mystery novel by Gregory Maguire *[[The Lost (book)|''The Lost'' (book)]], a memoir by Daniel Mendelsohn *''Lost'', the second novel of [[Alice Lichtenstein]] *[[Lost (Australian novel)|''Lost'' (Australian novel)]], a 2005 Michael Robotham novel *[[Lost: A Memoir]], 2009 memoir by Canadian author Cathy Ostlere ==In music== *[[Lost (band)]], an Italian pop rock band ===Albums=== *[[Lost (Carpark North album)|''Lost'' (Carpark North album)]], the Carpark North international debut studio album *[[Lost (Cool Calm Pete album)|''Lost'' (Cool Calm Pete album)]], the Cool Calm Pete debut solo album *[[Lost (Eightball album)|''Lost'' (Eightball album)]], the debut solo album from rapper 8Ball *[[Lost (RTZ album)|''Lost'' (RTZ album)]], the 1999 Return to Zero album by American rock band *[[Lost (Elegy album)|''Lost'' (Elegy album)]], 1995 Elegy album ===Songs=== *[[Lost (Faith Hill song)|"Lost" (Faith Hill song)]], a 2007 song written by Mitch Allan and Kara DioGuardi and was recorded by American country singer Faith Hill, the first released from her album ''The Hits'' *[[Lost (Gorilla Zoe song)|"Lost" (Gorilla Zoe song)]], Gorilla Zoe's single from ''Don't Feed Da Animals'' *[[Lost (Lasgo song)|"Lost" (Lasgo song)]], the third single released by the Belgian dance group Lasgo after the addition of Jelle Van Dael as vocals. The video was shot in Blackpool (UK). It started immediately to climb the national charts *[[Lost (Menudo song)|"Lost" (Menudo song)]], a song by the Puerto Rican boy band, Menudo. It was released as a digital single with virtually no album support in June 2008. While it failed to enter the Billboard Hot 100, it instead charted on its companion Pop 100 chart at number 61 *[[Lost (Michael Bublé song)|"Lost" (Michael Bublé song)]], the second single from Michael Bublé's third studio album, ''Call Me Irresponsible''. The song was inspired by the breakup with his former fiancée Debbie Timuss *[[Lost (Roger Sanchez song)|"Lost" (Roger Sanchez song)]], a 2006 single by Grammy Award winning Dominican-American progressive house DJ Roger Sanchez, featuring Lisa Pure and Katherine Ellis *[[Lost (Skin song)|"Lost" (Skin song)]], a double A-sided single from ex-Skunk Anansie front woman Skin. The single was scheduled for release towards the end of 2003 but failed to be commercially released. Only promo copies were sent out to radio stations *"[[Lost!]]", by Coldplay *"Lost", by [[Annie Lennox]] *"Lost", by [[Anouk (singer)|Anouk]] *"Lost", by [[Autechre]] *"Lost", by [[Avenged Sevenfold (album)|Avenged Sevenfold]] *"Lost", by Clockwork Radio from ''[[State of Mind EP]]'' *"Lost", by [[Dead by April]] *"Lost", by [[Delain]] *"Lost", by Edge Of Sanity, from ''[[The Spectral Sorrows]]'' *"Lost", by [[Haji's Kitchen]] *"[[One of the Boys (Katy Perry album)|Lost]]", by Katy Perry *"Lost", by [[Killswitch Engage]] *"Lost", by [[Korn]] *"Lost", by 1995 [[Kreator]] *"Lost", by [[Orbital (band)]] *"Lost", by [[Red (band)]] *"Lost", by [[The Church (band)]] *"Lost", by [[The Cure]] *"Lost", by [[Tristania (band)]] *"Lost", by [[Van der Graaf Generator]] ==In video games== *[[The Lost (video game)|''The Lost'' (video game)]], a 2002 vaporware game by Irrational Games *''[[Lost: Via Domus]]'', a 2008 video game by Ubisoft based on the ''Lost'' TV series ==Other uses== *abbreviation for [[Local option sales tax]] *[[Lost, Aberdeenshire]], a hamlet in Scotland *[[Mustard gas]], also known as Lost, LOST, Schwefel-lost or S-Lost, from the company '''''Lo'''mmel and '''St'''einkopf'' *a person in [[Solitude]] *"Lost", a slang term for being under the influence of the hypnotic drug [[Ambien]] {{disambiguation}}
